TextView.android:text: H. Constraints to Main Economic Activities
In the table below, rank the constraints faced by households in this livelihood zone (1 is the most pressing constraint).
Income from Waged Labour rank from 1 (most pressing constraint) to 5 (least important constraint)
Too few jobs, lack of demand for labour
Too much time spent on farm
Income/Consumption from Crop Production rank from 1 (most pressing constraint) to 9 (least important constraint)
Lack of reliable water, unfavourable climate
Low quality seed stock and planting materials
Lack of access to markets, low producer prices
Livestock Production rank from 1 (most pressing constraint) to 7 (least important constraint)
High costs/restricted supplies of veterinary drugs
Lack of market, low prices for animals
Insecurity/raid risk of holding animal stock
Fishing (coastal or inland) rank from 1 to 6
Lack of equipment, high cost of equipment
Natural resource based activities (charcoal, firewood,forest products, hunting and gathering) rank 1 to 4
Too much population pressure on NR
Restrictions on rights to exploit natural resources
Small enterprises and non-farm production (including retail, trading, petty commodity production) rank 1 to 5
Lack of capital, weak financial services
Too many taxes, tax rates too high
